alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 11:55AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Bureau and Putnam Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1155 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from La Moille to near Henry. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Bureau and Putnam Counties, including the following locations... Seatonville, Cherry, Mark, Standard, Coal Hollow, Magnolia, Zearing, Ottville, Van Orin and Malden. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 62 and 72. Interstate 180 between mile markers 1 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
